Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.

This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues occu

This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Everything el

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessi

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.

We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  E

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who ha

Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced

  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.   It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced the events go

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news. We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news. In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced the current events may help certain people grasp them better.

  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced the current events may help certain people grasp them better.

We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced the current events may help certain people grasp them better.

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced the current events may help certain people grasp them better.

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news. Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced the current events may help certain people grasp them better.

Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced the current events may help certain people grasp them better.  

We live during a time where the distrust of news seems to be at a high.  Are there moral implications for keeping up with

This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced the current events may help certain people grasp them better.

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced the current events may help certain people grasp them better.

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced the current events may help certain people grasp them better.  

We live during a time where the distrust of news seems to be at a high.  Are there moral implications intertwined with keeping up with the news?

This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.

  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced the current events may help certain people grasp them better.  

We live during a time where the distrust of news seems to be at a high.  Are there moral implications intertwined with keeping up with the news?  No.  Yo

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced the current events may help certain people grasp them better.  

We live during a time where the distrust of news seems to be at a high.  Are there moral implications intertwined with keeping up with the news?  No.  Whether you are good a

Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.   

Ultimately, our number one responsibility in life is to take care of ourselves.  Anything else is good, but not a necessity.   You aren't a bad person if you don't keep up with the news.  In fact, you can still keep up with current events by talking with people.  Engaging with people who have actually experienced the current events may help certain people grasp them better.  

We live during a time where the distrust of news seems to be at a high.  Are there moral implications intertwined with keeping up with the news?  No.  Whether you are good or bad should not b

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.

We live during a time where the distrust of news seems to be at a high.  Are there moral implications intertwined with keeping up with the news?  No.  Whether you are good or bad citizen should not be base whether you watch the news.

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In my opinion, you are not a bad citizen if you do not keep up with the news.  The news can be very depressing to watch.  Certain people may not be able to handle the mental stress that comes from constantly watching the news.  The news rarely covers good or uplifting stories.  Most of the stories are focused on crime, disasters, and negative situations.

he news can deceive some people by making them believe that all of society is bad and horrible.
  It can present a sensationalize view of the world.  For example, if a plane crashes, then there will be constant news coverage of the plane crash.  We have 24-hour news channels that will constantly cover the plane crash.  People who are highly influenced by the news may then think that airplanes are not safe to be on.  This is despite that the fact airplane crashes are generally very rare.  

I think there are certain types of people that just don't react well to the news.  They are best focusing on the issues directly affecting them in their lives.
